meanings.definition: Capable of being barred or obstructed.
meanings.sent1: The gate was barrable with a simple lock.
meanings.sent2: The window was barrable with sturdy bars.
meanings.sent3: It was quite barrable when the cat tried to jump over the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were barrable, like a dam holding back a flood.
meanings.sent5: The roadblock was barrable, causing a traffic jam.

meanings.definition: Able to be prevented or prohibited.
meanings.sent1: The dangerous behavior was barrable with strict rules.
meanings.sent2: The spread of rumors was barrable with clear communication.
meanings.sent3: It seemed barrable to resist eating the tempting cake.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was barrable, like trying to contain a burst of joy.
meanings.sent5: The fire was barrable, thanks to the quick response of the firefighters.
